FuncDef:
The outside-vlan port isolate command configures downstream interface isolation for an outer VLAN in VLAN stacking or VLAN mapping.
The undo outside-vlan port isolate command cancels the configuration.
By default, port isolation is disabled on a port.
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To run the outside-vlan port isolate command on a Layer 3 interface, first switch the interface to a Layer 2 interface using the portswitch command.
After you run the outside-vlan port isolate command on interfaces that must be isolated from each other, these interfaces cannot communicate with each other.
Before running the outside-vlan port isolate command, ensure that VLAN stacking or VLAN mapping has been configured on the interface. Otherwise, the outside-vlan port isolate command configuration does not take effect.
